messages.content:
Answer the given question. You must conduct reasoning inside <think> and </think> first every time you get new information. After reasoning, if you find you lack some knowledge, you can call a search engine by <search> query </search> and it will return the top searched results between <information> and </information>. You can search as many times as your want. If you find no further external knowledge needed, you can directly provide the answer inside <answer> and </answer>, without detailed illustrations. For example, <answer> Beijing </answer>. Question: Help me to compile a complete list of U.S. Supreme Court justices who were successfully confirmed from President Richard Nixon’s first term through President Joe Biden’s term. For each justice, record:
Name, Position (Chief Justice or Associate Justice), Tenure Start Date(in the format as YYYY-MM-DD), Tenure End Date (enter “NA” for currently serving justices as of the end of 2024), Nominating President, President’s Party Affiliation, Ideological Leaning (Conservative or Liberal), Most Recent Prior Position

Please output the organized data in Markdown table format.
The column names in the table should be, in order:
Name | Position | Tenure Start Date | Tenure End Date | Nominating President | President’s Party | Ideological Leaning | Previous Position

Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the columns without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is: 
 ```markdown
{data_content}
```.?

<think>
We need to gather information about each justice nominated during this period, including their tenure, ideological leaning, and previous positions. We'll start with the first president mentioned and continue until the last one.
</think>

<search>Richard Nixon Supreme Court nominations </search>

Search query: Richard Nixon Supreme Court nominations
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Nixon_Supreme_Court_candidates):
Richard Nixon Supreme Court candidates - Wikipedia Warren E. Burger nomination · Harry Blackmun nomination · Lewis Powell and William Rehnquist nominations.

[Doc 2](https://www.nixonlibrary.gov/news/nixon-and-supreme-court):
Nixon and the Supreme Court | Richard Nixon Museum and Library Nixon's Nominations​​ Richard Nixon nominated six justices to the Supreme Court (four of which were confirmed by the Senate) during his ...

[Doc 3](https://www.senate.gov/legislative/nominations/SupremeCourtNominations1789present.htm):
Supreme Court Nominations (1789-Present) - Senate.gov President Nixon, Richard. Rehnquist, William H. Harlan, Oct 22, 1971, 68-26 No. 450, C, Dec 10, 1971. Powell, Lewis F., Jr. Black, Oct 22, 1971, 89-1 No. 439, C ...

Search query: Harry Blackmun biography
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.oyez.org/justices/harry_a_blackmun):
Harry A. Blackmun - Oyez Blackmun was born on November 12, 1908 to Theo and Corwin Blackmun. Growing up in St. Paul, Minnesota, where his father owned a small store, Blackmun ...

[Doc 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_Blackmun):
Harry Blackmun - Wikipedia Harold Andrew Blackmun (November 12, 1908 – March 4, 1999) was an American lawyer and jurist who served as an associate justice of the Supreme Court

[Doc 3](https://supremecourthistory.org/associate-justices/harry-a-blackmun-1970-1994/):
Previous Associate Justices: Harry A. Blackmun, 1970-1994 Justice Blackmun served on the Supreme Court for twenty-four years and retired on August 3, 1994. He died on March 4, 1999 at the age of ninety.

Search query: Warren E. Burger biography
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Warren_E._Burger):
Warren E. Burger - Wikipedia Warren Earl Burger (September 17, 1907 – June 25, 1995) was an American attorney who served as the 15th chief justice of the United States from 1969 to 1986.

[Doc 2](https://www.oyez.org/justices/warren_e_burger):
Warren E. Burger - Oyez He was born in Saint Paul, Minnesota in 1907. The youngest of seven children, Burger grew up in a working class family. The large family struggled to make ends ...

[Doc 3](https://supremecourthistory.org/chief-justices/warren-burger-1969-1986/):
Previous Chief Justices: Warren E. Burger, 1969-1986 BURGER was born in St. Paul, Minnesota, on September 17, 1907. After pre-legal studies at the University of Minnesota in high classes, he earned a law degree in ...

Search query: William Rehnquist biography
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Rehnquist):
William Rehnquist - Wikipedia William Hubbs Rehnquist (October 1, 1924 – September 3, 2005) was an American attorney who served as the 16th chief justice of the United States from 1986 ...

[Doc 2](https://www.oyez.org/justices/william_h_rehnquist):
William H. Rehnquist - Oyez William Hubbs Rehnquist is remembered as one of the most successful Chief Justices of the Supreme Court of the United States.

[Doc 3](https://supremecourthistory.org/chief-justices/william-rehnquist-1986-2005/):
Previous Chief Justices: William H. Rehnquist, 1986-2005 WILLIAM HUBBS REHNQUIST was born in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, October 1, 1924. He grew up in the suburb of Shorewood, the son of a paper salesman.

| William Rehnquist| Associate| 1972-09-05        | 2005-09-03         | Nixon               | Republican       | Conservative         | Judge             |

On this day, John Paul Stevens nominated to the Supreme Court On November 28, 1975, President Gerald Ford made his only Supreme Court nomination when he selected federal judge John Paul Stevens to the nation's highest ...

Supreme Court Nominations (1789-Present) - Senate.gov Since the Supreme Court was established in 1789, presidents have submitted 165 nominations for the Court, including those for chief justice. ... President Ford, ...

[Doc 3](https://guides.loc.gov/us-supreme-court-mss/appointed-ford):
Appointed by President Ford (1975-1977) - U.S. Supreme Court ... Collections relating to US Supreme Court Associate Justices appointed by President Ford. The collection titles on this page link to fuller bibliographic ...
